A01D0E5E951C4C21A375ADF67EF23887.description: Discuss the meaning and impact of variations when communicating.

DB8DC532110A428B93B3422E81BF364A.description: Evaluate own and others' talk, including giving constructive feedback.

03211C5B09E242818131AAAF4EDD659F.description: Make decisions about the level of support needed to deliver a speech or presentation, e.g. reading aloud, using notes, visual aids.

7076DAAEDF2E4EE6946DD36D491DD82E.description: Plan and deliver presentations and persuasive speeches confidently in a range of contexts, making choices about the most appropriate media.

FE9CE52666E94887A93D7043F1EEF30E.description: Demonstrate empathy and understanding of a range of characters through flexible choice of speech, gesture and movement in a dramatic scene.

42A41D6DEC854B709E44EB71126B4CDC.description: Show evidence of reading ahead when reading an unseen text aloud.

F1A69329B1DB45BF9DD5E4F589278151.description: Read aloud with confidence, accuracy and style.

1A250D39D3D642EAA275FE1ACE1F3754.description: Balance the needs of others and the task when turn-taking, showing sensitivity about when to contribute and when to listen.

FAEA3FEF1103429989FC55BDA3427546.description: Develop a discussion by synthesising and building on the shared ideas.

AAAFEFD8A25E4CA3B18A62D77D5425A4.description: Explore points of agreement and disagreement to gain a greater understanding of the issues and meet the needs of the task.

AD9706851C324A2592276CDB5EEA61D7.description: Independently identify and take up group roles as needed, and demonstrate expertise.

A81074B6F46D4822A86C6FCC0CC3154F.description: Listen, evaluate what is heard, and generate a reasoned response that draws on a range of sources.

56B7160B6DCE44DC84E325C16A3D4B81.description: Adapt communication to create appropriate impact on different audiences.

833B84056B784DEE9F8B3ED1F8AC7518.description: Use non-verbal communication techniques to enhance meaning.

08BEB7BB89EF451D86646F17E8AD112A.description: Adapt language to express complex ideas and opinions in detail.

392437CD06254B0D9A0394210FC85BC5.description: Sustain an effective organisation of talk in a range of familiar contexts.

7289F12470AD4F9B87A24657193BF6BF.description: Adapt speech purposefully in a range of familiar and unfamiliar contexts to maximise its impact on the audience.

70A01FDFF1074EBFA1CB9FED5C2C7246.description: Evaluate and edit to improve the accuracy and effectiveness of language, grammar and structure of a range of different texts.

D12001C0C4A9439D9C81E496052CD1D2.description: Use specific choices and combinations of layouts and presentation to create particular effects in texts (handwritten, printed and onscreen).

9271D815C62C450AAD33160DFF42579F.description: Use the most appropriate way of note-taking for the identified purpose and use notes to inform writing.

077BA27580B24ECB8427F0B33898682A.description: Sustain a fast, fluent and legible handwriting style.

C92DF1983B2047538B7681730C42AF71.description: Begin to combine the use of structural, linguistic and literary features to create a specific effect.

117B558CE0FE4FF5909E87E9C3D230A7.description: Develop distinctive voices, both personal and for different characters.

E44BD38BCA24483083B4F3477605BA69.description: Use a consistent viewpoint in fiction and non-fiction writing.

68C6C19DA9A1418BB8BB14F7FEF7D481.description: Create content to suit a wide range of audiences.

A48E8C89E845432EBA7517F76BED87E2.description: Use relevant features consistently for a chosen purpose to clarify meaning.

30A58D00A8C548779E2BFD15EDC5B5C7.description: Use the most appropriate approach to planning writing in order to generate, organise and shape ideas.

7217596639A24B62A9FA1EA6AD99CF32.description: Write confidently in a range of different genres of fiction and types of poems.

361E4F0CF51A4EC7AC9AFDF16E527B58.description: Use carefully chosen connectives and sentence openings to clarify or emphasise connections in writing.

93E5CD03F2704E6398A8BC43007B1B4A.description: Use a range of organisational features to support the intended purpose and audience.

ADA74CE8EDCD4D4E9BF336EB3B3777B9.description: Use features of text structure to demonstrate a sense of linked progression.

BF21553DC6B745CA937F43AC3AF813AD.description: Vary the degrees of formality and informality when making choices of register in writing, according to the identified context, purpose and audience.

DFBC12A77E5F463E81FA9F9573FA2BDB.description: Use the conventions of standard English in specific contexts for particular effects.

9E314630645544F9872F424F3932457B.description: Create detail and convey shades of meaning through the grammatical structure of sentences, e.g. controlling order of clauses.

0E1785D872174833BDCD4D51174EB0A6.description: Use simple, compound, complex and compound-complex sentences accurately, beginning to manipulate them for effect on the whole text.

345DBE36308F4B8FB298C9B8FB94B39D.description: Use all punctuation accurately and to enhance meaning.

6CA23EA9E30142348B5BA74B8AD775FF.description: Use a range of sources to develop and extend the range of language used in written work.

485BC163DFB946D8A5BFBBF2BF8FC5BC.description: Create effects by using a range of linguistic and literary techniques.

FED9186C0D374B15BBFC4449BFFA8AF4.description: Create and control meaning through precise use of a range and variety of language.

CE1E96856BFA4184AE6B037DB87D3A61.description: Use, with confidence, a range of strategies for spelling correctly.

86A1FDD933DD4C12AF678F385E600574.description: Show understanding of word families, roots, derivations and morphology in spelling.

8619FD16FC7F4DBDB76B57FA96CE521D.description: Spell most words correctly, including some complex polysyllabic words and unfamiliar words.

DDC6991450934533A0637E4C6CEE88C1.description: Discuss why certain texts are important within a culture, and show awareness that the context in which a text is written and read affects its meaning.

6D3FE20D90624724818FFD85A1EDA29A.description: Explore how different readers choose and respond to texts.

4D05E30BBDA14CA18300EF324D244EFB.description: Make a reasoned choice when reading for different purposes, including for pleasure.

CCE31E1121A34131961C5D6AB6E5C541.description: Express informed personal responses to texts.

23DF9891C31D485DB11EED8C60E0244F.description: Enjoy reading a wide range of texts.

1D5F98466F454AA7BAA37FDDDB39DA40.description: Discuss the range of techniques writers use to distinguish between different voices.

394F7B40C2324A548BB98621D47A33F4.description: Trace the development of ideas, viewpoints and purposes through a text and relate these to other texts read.

184098F2B7A34FC8A81B474206CAA698.description: Explain how a writer combines structural, linguistic and literary features for effect.

7C45E8E69EF842C3954B2E8191B03320.description: Compare and comment on the textual features used in more than one text to develop similar themes and elicit responses from the reader.

7BEACC4EC1CA4F8080EAF939B50A001E.description: Use relevant textual references when supporting or disagreeing with a point.

F386F94536544013A545B23529282EE5.description: Use a range of reading strategies to identify and distinguish between main and subsidiary points in texts.

22820FC16E944EEABC4609FF0D3F80C3.description: Collate and summarise ideas and information from multiple texts.

5936EA39CDF24C54AB67B8FF0206E990.description: Comment on the impact of bias in a text.

203333319AC149499CD13C4E0320E808.description: Comment on a writer's implied meaning and intended effect.

C1E0C3B9C001478D85A598039AB341DC.description: Identify and discuss the impact of explicit information on the reader.

030FCBF37C464B86B63492F37DD7AD49.description: Read and discuss a range of non-fiction text types.

D08BEB6C90224869B8285B6BFF2FF062.description: Read and discuss a range of fiction genres, poems and playscripts, including the contribution of any visual elements or multimedia.

8C6E24C1385D41699AAF999419C3D9D1.description: Comment on how a writer's choice of connectives and sentence openings clarifies or emphasises connections in a specific context.

F32EB7AD6A3449189FE270257D6BD8B9.description: Discuss how a writer organises and links the content of their text for clarity and effect.

43A4B3AA94EF4D4EB61E57F3CB329E47.description: Discuss how a writer uses features of text structure for effect in a range of fiction and non-fiction texts, including poetic forms.

5C33DC73B848477EB8FBB95F3D94C4A6.description: Comment on the use of formal and informal language in a text and a writer's motivation for making the choice.

3E9E33CC47D4447685CB277BEC0EA4D1.description: Comment on ways in which a writer uses standard and non-standard English for effect.

741659D1DBA849BEB52A2B62A48178E2.description: Comment on how a writer builds up detail and conveys shades of meaning through the grammatical structure of their sentences.

FD9F27BFA01F4C579E65531AA29C6D92.description: Explain how a writer uses simple, compound, complex and compound-complex sentences for effect in their writing.

74308DDA7F02471899245A2BD879F123.description: Explain how a writer's choice of punctuation can convey shades of meaning.

486E90E0E988496981D67CED9ADDDB08.description: Explain possible interpretations, explicit and implicit, of a writer's use of linguistic and literary techniques, e.g. explaining how hyperbole suggests a character's attitude, or how an oxymoron is used to emphasise a point.

893B3EBBE58E4D94B03CE8C65C3F33E8.description: Compare texts from different cultures and times, commenting on the use of language to develop similar themes.

F4B61AA56BB943C0A051960A24C42F89.description: Explain how a writer's choice of language contributes to the intended purpose and overall impact on the reader.

8BD2926FD445410088AB62F84F38331E.description: Deduce the meanings of unfamiliar words in context using a range of strategies, including knowledge of word families, etymology and morphology.

42AAADBDBC68432589F6D62F1802552F.description: This sub-strand appears only in the primary curriculum.
